TopicTitle: any KSP youtubers here? need help.

Articles.Content:
Hello. I need help from some KSP youtubers. If you can help me by answering my questions, you will be rewarded greatly.

Specifically, i need help about video data usage. For a 720p video, what's the average ratio of MB of data used per second of video? I can make decent-quality 720p videos that use just under 1 MB of data per second. I am just not sure if that is too much data to be used, or wether it is okay.

Am i getting across to anyone? I'm not quite sure how else to word it.

Again, if you can answer this question, it would be a BIG help! CHEERS!
Fraps will get you ten minutes for about 5 gigs, if I remember correctly.

Not very often in YouTube here, but for me I have 7:30 in 536 MB, so... about 1.19 MB/s, and that was a video processed by Windows Movie Maker 2012.

Still, it depends on your video encoder. One of my encoder got 24 minutes in about 1.11 GB.

It's all answered here:

https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/1722171?hl=en

and it can be accessed by searching for: youtube 720p kbps, on Google.
